newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Netanyahu meets Levy on coalition.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Netanyahu meets Levy on coalition.

text.p: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met Foreign Minister David Levy on Wednesday in a bid to settle political differences which have shaken Israel's government.
The two men held talks for the first time since Levy threatened on Monday to quit over Netanyahu's handling of the government and Middle East peacemaking.

Netanyahu was expected to assure Levy that he would guide daily peacemaking with Palestinians, a process which has been deadlocked since Israel started building a Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem last March.
"I hope the meeting between the prime minister and the foreign minister will end the current crisis, " said Netanyahu's spokesman Shai Bazak.
Levy's resignation threat was triggered by the disclosure on Friday that cabinet minister Ariel Sharon met last month with top PLO official Mahmoud Abbas without the foreign minister's knowledge.
"When the discussion ends he (Levy) will have to decide if he can continue being a partner in the government or not," said the head of Levy's five-member Gesher faction in parliament, Maksim Levy.
